item.title: The Missing Semester of your CS Education [MIT]
02. Shell Tools
item.description: Topic 2: Shell Tools. MIT Computer Science. https://missing.csail.mit.edu/2020/shell-tools/. Unlike other scripting programming languages, shell scripting is optimized for shell related tasks, e.g. reading from STDIN and saving results into files are primitives. At the cost of being painful on the eyes. Python scripts are way more readable (and cross-platform) than shell scripts. Pesky Whitespace foo = bar # Doesn't work because it's interpreted as calling the foo program with the args '=' and 'bar' foo=bar # Now that works!
